segments.text: I'm still trying to process what I'm seeing in this kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is standing right there, completely lost in her task of drying a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Doesn't she feel the water rising around her feet?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Itâ€™s absolutely unbelievable how unaware she is of the overflowing sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The faucet is clearly on, and the water is just continuously pouring out.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That water is going to cause serious damage to the cabinets and floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want to yell at her to turn off the tap!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Meanwhile, behind her, the children are up to no good, risking a fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is dangerously balanced on that wobbly stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She needs to look around and take charge of this situation.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her complete detachment from her surroundings is quite concerning.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This isn't just a small spill; it's a full-blown flood.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's frustrating to watch these events unfold simultaneously.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone needs to intervene before things get even worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This scene is a perfect storm of domestic hazards.
segments.speaker: PAR
